title: Two Sides of a President in One Photo
sub_head: A picture taken shortly before the historic address, the ‘Gettysburg Lincoln’ captures an Abraham Lincoln who is both serious and sly.
body: As Abraham Lincoln’s assistant private secretary, John Hay, cryptically noted in his diary on Sunday, Nov. 8, 1863: “Went with Mrs Ames to Gardner’s gallery & were soon joined by Nico & the Prest. We had a great many pictures taken. Some of the Presdt. the best I have ever seen.”
